basics.name: Joanne Oshiro
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Information & Computer Science at the University of Hawaii at Manoa. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2025.

highlights: Applied strong leadership talents and problem-solving skills to maintain team efficiency and organize workflows.
Handled customer complaints, resolved issues and adjusted policies to meet changing needs.
Quickly and accurately counted drawers at the end of each shift.
Handling money, restocking merchandise and helping customers locate products.
Providing fast, high-quality customer service to guests.
Team collaboration and resolving issues with customers, waitstaff and management.
Made and served a variety of drinks with speed, quality, and consistency.
Developed strong knowledge of menu offerings, enabling prompt and accurate order taking.
Demonstrated strong multitasking abilities by preparing multiple orders simultaneously without compromising quality.
Reduced food waste by efficiently managing ingredients inventory and rotating stock as needed.
Demonstrated adaptability by quickly learning new recipes and techniques as menu items evolved, ensuring a seamless transition for customers.
Handled high-volume orders during peak times with accuracy and speed while maintaining attention to detail for each pizza creation.

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.
